As a sorcerer, you gain the following class features.

Hit Points

Hit Dice: 1d6 per sorcerer level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per sorcerer level after 1st

Proficiencies

Armor: None
Weapons: Daggers, darts, slings, quarterstaffs, light crossbows
Tools: None
Saving Throws: Constitution, Charisma
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Persuasion, and Religion

Equipment

You start with the following equipment, in addition to equipment provided by your background:

  • (a) a @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-items.0MTCBKU7Yvtg8Mhf]{Light Crossbow} and 20 @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-items.mDRrbkjggqpDJ3xD]{Crossbow Bolts} or (b) @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-journals.SPzXa5i5cD7tZ1b9]{any simple weapon}
  • (a) a @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-items.2O54GwvwF34C7UpL]{Component Pouch} or (b) an arcane focus
  • (a) a @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-items.pI51kNF0SPoi13po]{Dungeoneer's Pack} or (b) a @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-items.DndDRdbpbQp6Ey5i]{Explorer's Pack}
  • Two @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-items.QrHS8FqbAi0Lsk9J]{Daggers}

Alternatively, you can roll [[/roll 2d4 * 10]] gp and buy your equipment.

Note: This is a rebalanced roll calculated by thinkdm.org. The canon roll is [[/roll 3d4 * 10]].

The Sorcerer

Golden eyes blazing, a human extends a hand and unleashes the dragon fire that burns within her veins. As flames rage around her enemies, leathery wings unfurl from her back and she takes to the sky.

Long hair whipped by a conjured wind, a half-elf throws back his head and spreads his arms. Lifted momentarily from the ground, a wave of magic surges in him, through him, and out of him in a powerful burst of lightning.

Crouching behind a stalagmite, a halfling points a finger at a charging troglodyte. A burst of fire leaps from her finger to strike the creature. She ducks back behind the rock formation with a smile, unaware that her wild magic has tinted her skin a bright blue.

Sorcerers bear a magical heritage conferred by an exotic lineage, an otherworldly influence, or exposure to unknown cosmic forces. Magic can't be studied like a language, nor can a legendary life be learned. No one chooses sorcery; the power chooses the sorcerer.

Wild Magic

Magic is a part of every sorcerer, suffusing body, mind, and spirit with a latent power waiting to be tapped. Some sorcerers wield magic that comes from an ancient lineage imbued with the magic of dragons. Others hold within them a raw, uncontrolled magic, a chaotic storm that manifests in unpredictable ways.

The appearance of sorcerous powers is extremely unpredictable. Some draconic lineages produce only one sorcerer per generation, but in other lines of descent, every individual is a sorcerer. Most of the time, sorcerous talents manifest as apparent coincidences. Some sorcerers can't name the source of their power, while others trace it to strange events in their own lives. The touch of a demon, the blessing of a dryad at a baby's birth, or a sip of water from a mysterious spring could ignite the gift of sorcery. Similarly, the gift of a deity of magic, exposure to the elemental forces of the Inner Planes or the mad chaos of Limbo, or a glimpse into the inner workings of reality could be the cause.

Sorcerers have no use for the spellbooks and ancient tomes of magical lore that wizards use, nor do they rely on a patron to grant them spells like warlocks. By learning to channel and focus their own innate magic, they can discover new and wondrous ways to release that power.

Unfathomable Powers

Sorcerers are rare in the world, and it is unusual to find a sorcerer who isn't involved in some sort of adventuring life. People with magical power coursing through their veins soon discover that the power doesn't want to stay quiet. A sorcerer's magic wants to be used, and it tends to spill out unpredictably if not called upon.

Sorcerers often have obscure or chivalrous motivations that drive them to adventure. Some seek a better understanding of the magical force that infuses them, or the answer to the mystery of its origin. Others hope to find a way to get rid of it, or to unleash its full potential. Whatever their goals, sorcerers are as useful to a group of adventurers as wizards, making up for a relative lack of depth in their magical knowledge with enormous flexibility in the use of the spells they know.

Multiclassing

If your group uses the optional multiclassing rule in the Player's Handbook, here is what you need to know if you choose sorcerer as one of your classes.

Minimum Ability Score. As a multiclass character, you must have at least a 13 Charisma to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a sorcerer.

Proficiencies Gained. If sorcerer isn't your initial class, you don't gain any proficiencies when you take your first level in sorcerer.

Spell Slots. You are a full spellcaster. Add all your sorcerer class levels to the appropriate levels of other classes to determine your available spell slots.

Please refer to the @UUID[Compendium.5e-complete-fr.5e-journals.a5xwmx4d5X1FHEct]{Multiclassing Rules} for more information on multiclassing.
